page.title: 10Religion at Holbeach Hurn.
page.content: The church at Holbeach Hurn is called St. Lukes.It was built in 1869.Before this a barn had been used.The present vicar is called Andrew Stokes.He is also vicar of Holbeach Bank,Holbeach St. Marks and Holbeach St. Matthew but he lives in the vicarage at the Hurn.There are services every Sunday but the best attended ones are at Christmas,Easter and Harvest.There is a special children's crib service at Christmas. There is a Sunday school each Sunday at the same time as the service.Sometimes one of the other churches in the group will hold the main service.Mr. Stokes takes assemblies at the two nearby primary schools and also at Hovenden House,the local Leonard Cheshire home on the outskirts of the village.There is a large painting in the church.It is of the Virgin and Child.
